abstract: A description of estimated lens distortion that can be used to rectify images.
overview:
## Overview

See also: `AVCameraCalibrationData`

Example of a per-pixel undistort function using this data:

items.description: Initializes a new immutable data structure describing lens distortion estimation.
items.name: init(center:radialLookupTable:)

items.description: The center pixel of the radial distortion mapping.
items.name: center

items.description: A linear interpolation lookup table from the `center` to the maximum distance corner of the image.  This describes the magnification of radius at a given radius. This is the same structure as `lensDistortionLookupTable` in `AVCameraCalibrationData` and can be used in a similar manner, with the data already converted into a float array.
items.name: radialLookupTable

items.description: A component that applies a visual effect to a hierarchy of entities when a person looks at or selects an entity.
items.name: HoverEffectComponent

items.description: A component that orients an entity instance so that it continuously points toward the active camera.
items.name: BillboardComponent

items.description: A component that controls how an entity blends visually with objects in the local environment.
items.name: EnvironmentBlendingComponent

items.description: A component that supports general image presentation.
items.name: ImagePresentationComponent

title: LensDistortionData
